alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Johnson; Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 10:45PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Cedar, southeastern Johnson and northwestern Muscatine Counties through 1115 PM CST... At 1045 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lone Tree, or 11 miles south of West Branch, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Nichols around 1050 PM CST. West Liberty around 1100 PM CST. Atalissa and Rochester around 1105 PM CST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Durant and Wilton. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 260 and 275. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
